summary: Each year, millions of passengers travel internationally on U.S. and foreign airlines. Some of these airlines have formed alliances to coordinate and integrate their prices and schedules. Alliances may be granted immunity from U.S. antitrust laws if the Department of Transportation determines that consumers will benefit from this coordination and there won’t be a harmful effect on airline competition. Transportation monitors these alliances to ensure...
title: International Air Alliances: Greater Transparency Needed on DOT's Efforts to Monitor the Effects of Antitrust Immunity
